title: Senior systemutvecklare till Karlskrona
description:
**KARLSKRONA**
**Systemutveckling**


**Senior systemutvecklare**


I takt med att vi växer med nya spännande uppdrag behöver vi också bli fler! Vi söker därför fler kollegor som vill arbeta med systemutveckling. Vi rekryterar inte till en specifik roll utan lyssnar på dig och din erfarenhet och hittar tillsammans en roll som du skulle trivas och utvecklas i. Här har du stor frihet att välja uppdrag hos någon av våra lokala, nationella och internationella kunder.


**Våra ambitioner**


Hos oss är individen i fokus. Vi vet att vi blir som mest framgångsrika tillsammans om du mår bra på fritiden och på jobbet. Vi ger dig därför förutsättningarna för en mer flexibel vardag där du får friheten att välja hur mycket du vill jobba och om du vill arbeta hemifrån, hos kund eller in-house i våra fina lokaler.


**VI ERBJUDER:**


* Intressanta uppdrag hos någon av våra många kunder. Vi jobbar i huvudsak med långa uppdrag, vilket ger dig goda förutsättningar för att skapa värde hos kunden samtidigt som du själv utvecklas
* En trygg månadslön – vi bestämmer tillsammans en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag
* Tjänstebil – vi ser gärna att du väljer en elbil
* Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter att löneväxla
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring
* Afterworks och kollegiala forum
* Kompetensutveckling – du sätter din egen budget och väljer själv vilka utbildningar du vill delta i
* Kontor i Karlskrona – läs mer om vårt kontor **här**
* Konferensresor inom och utom Sverige tillsammans med dina kollegor.
* Möjlighet till delägarskap.


**DIN KOMPETENS**:


* Flerårig erfarenhet av systemutveckling. Antingen fullstack, back-end eller front-end
* Erfarenhet av agila processer
* Intresse för att utvecklas inom ditt hantverk

* Kontor i Östersund – läs mer om vårt kontor **här**
* Konferensresor inom och utom Sverige tillsammans med dina kollegor.
* Möjlighet till delägarskap.


**DIN KOMPETENS**:


* Flerårig erfarenhet av systemutveckling i Java, gärna i större, komplexa system.
* Erfarenhet av ramverk och verktyg som Spring/Spring Boot, JPA/Hibernate, REST, mikrotjänster eller liknande.
* Kunskap om containerteknologier (Docker, Kubernetes) och vana att arbeta med moderna utvecklingsmiljöer.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD, testautomatisering och versionshantering (Git).
* Vana av att arbeta i agila team och bidra till att förbättra arbetssätt och processer.
* Förmåga att ta arkitektoniskt ansvar, förstå helheten och fatta tekniska beslut som påverkar långsiktigt.
* Erfarenhet av att vara mentor eller tech lead och stötta andra utvecklare i teamet.
* Intresse för att utvecklas inom ditt hantverk och hålla dig uppdaterad kring nya tekniker och arbetssätt.

title: Seniora utvecklare & arkitekter till Knowit FLX Stockholm
description:
**Om oss:**  

Som anställd hos **Knowit** Solutions FLX, ett dotterbolag inom Knowit-koncernen, väljer du själv din lön, din pension, din arbetstid och dina uppdrag.  

Dina närmaste kollegor är andra seniora konsulter inom systemutveckling, arkitektur och projektledning.


Hos **Knowit** Solutions FLX är du anställd i ett mindre bolag med korta beslutsvägar, samtidigt som du får ta del av fördelarna med att tillhöra en av Nordens största IT-koncerner.

**Knowit** är ett av Nordens ledande IT-konsultbolag med över 4 000 medarbetare. Vi har ett stort antal ramavtal inom både offentlig och privat sektor, vilket ger tillgång till spännande kunduppdrag och möjligheter till kompetensutbyte. Hos Knowit får du möjlighet att arbeta både i resursuppdrag och i team- eller projektåtaganden tillsammans med dina kollegor.

**Vem är du?**  

Du har förmodligen arbetat i roller som **mjukvaruarkitekt, lösningsarkitekt, molnarkitekt och/eller senior utvecklare**, där du har tagit ansvar för komplexa system och drivit projekt från idé till färdig lösning.


Du är trygg i att fatta beslut, coacha andra utvecklare och kan bidra både strategiskt och praktiskt i utvecklingen.

 **Vi tror att du har:**

* Minst 8 års erfarenhet som systemutvecklare inom **Java och/eller .NET**
* Goda kunskaper inom **frontendutveckling** med exempelvis **React**, Vue eller Angular
* Erfarenhet av arbete med **molnplattformar** som **Azure**, AWS eller GCP
* Kunskap om **mikrotjänstarkitektur, eventdrivna system, integrationer och CI/CD-pipelines**
* Intresse för att kombinera **hands-on utveckling** med **arkitektur** och förmåga att stötta kollegor i tekniska beslut

  

**Varför Knowit FLX?**


Hos oss får du det bästa av två världar: friheten att själv forma din arbetssituation och tryggheten i en fast anställning.  

Du blir en del av ett kompetent nätverk av kollegor, får stöd av en stark säljorganisation som matchar dig med rätt uppdrag och har styrkan hos ett av Nordens största IT-konsultbolag i ryggen.


Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Phyton-utvecklare
description:
Vi söker erfarna och engagerade Python-utvecklare som vill bli en del av ett modernt och högpresterande agilt leveransteam. Du har minst åtta års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i **Python** och djup kompetens inom databashantering, antingen **SQL** eller **Oracle.** Tillsammans med andra utvecklare, testare, kravanalytiker och produktägare kommer du att bidra till utvecklingen av robusta, skalbara och användarcentrerade lösningar.


Som senior utvecklare får du en central roll i att omsätta verksamhetens behov till hållbara tekniska lösningar. Du arbetar nära dina kollegor för att analysera, designa och utveckla applikationer med fokus på kvalitet, prestanda och säkerhet. Du säkerställer att lösningarna fungerar både på kort och lång sikt – och att de kan förvaltas och vidareutvecklas med hög effektivitet.


Hos oss är det agila arbetssättet mer än en metod – det är en kultur. Vi utvecklar inkrementellt och iterativt, med regelbundna delleveranser som skapar kontinuerligt värde. Genom nära samarbete och täta dialoger med beställare och användare säkerställer vi att lösningarna är ändamålsenliga och långsiktigt hållbara.


Vi tror på att mål och visioner driver bättre resultat än detaljstyrning, och vi ser kommunikation och samarbete som grunden för innovation. Med vårt arbetssätt undviker vi halvfärdiga system och levererar tidigt konkreta resultat som gör skillnad.


Här får du möjligheten att arbeta i en miljö där din tekniska kompetens, ditt engagemang och din förmåga att skapa värde verkligen gör skillnad.

### **Vi söker dig som**

* Har minst 8 års erfarenhet av Python-utveckling.
* Har goda kunskaper inom SQL eller Oracle.
* Är van vid att arbeta med komplexa system och stora datamängder.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt i tvärfunktionella team.
* Förstår vikten av säkerhet, prestanda och långsiktigt hållbara lösningar.
* Är kommunikativ, samarbetsinriktad och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till teamet


Meriterande är om du har erfarenhet av:

* Molnplattformar (t.ex. AWS, Azure eller GCP).
* CI/CD och DevOps-processer.
* Containerteknologier som Docker eller Kubernetes.

  

Kontakta ansvarig kontaktperson Philip vid frågor eller funderingar runt rollen, philip.leopoldson@adavo.se.
Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity**

  

Do you have a passion for finance, forecasting, and driving smart investment decisions? We’re looking for an experienced, creative, and dynamic Radio Investment Controller to join our outstanding team within the TE1 domain in the IV&C department at PDU Radio.  

In this pivotal role, you will own the forecasting process for hardware and software investments, manage Capex/Opex budgets, and provide clear, data-driven insights to support decision-making. You will collaborate with stakeholders and cross-functional teams, ensuring resources are directed where they bring the most value. You won’t shy away from challenging assumptions – your critical thinking and ability to say 'no' when necessary will help guide sound financial outcomes.

 **What You Will Do**

* Lead financial forecasting and budgeting for Radio testing and development projects.
* Partner with stakeholders to review, challenge, and refine investment proposals.
* Evaluate and qualify hardware prototypes, driving innovation and quality.
* Prepare and deliver concept reviews for strategic decisions.
* Research new tools and methods to meet future requirements.
* Maintain high standards of documentation and compliance.
* Coach R&D colleagues and act as a competence builder through workshops and presentations.
* Support cross-organizational projects and drive collaborative success.
 **The Skills You Bring**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (or equivalent experience) in finance, engineering, or related field.
* Strong financial and forecasting skills, with advanced Microsoft Excel capability.
* General understanding of RF and Filter Technology, plus design experience in RF.
* Knowledge of Radio Products and technologies including WCDMA, GSM, 4G, and 5G.
* Exceptional problem-solving skills and the confidence to challenge stakeholders.
* Clear and compelling communication abilities in English.
* A calm, diplomatic, and professional demeanor.
* Prior experience within similar industry is a strong advantage.
  

Why Join Us? We work in lean, agile, multi-functional teams where diversity, collaboration, and knowledge-sharing inspire true innovation. Here, your work directly shapes the future of global radio technology.

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Req ID:** 773744

title: Junior Web Developer
description:
Hey there! Are you our next Leadstar? Take the chance of a lifetime and join a market leading, fast-paced team in the sports betting affiliate industry!
 



  





 We offer you:
 


* The opportunity to play an important role in one of the fastest growing tech companies in Sweden
* The opportunity to learn a lot and to develop yourself
* The prospect to grow within the company and take on more responsibilities
* A workplace where Mondays feel like Fridays



  





 What we want in return:
 


* A high level of commitment
* An eagerness to learn and to become the best
* Smartness and creativity
* A positive mindset



  





**Who are we looking for?** 




 We are looking for a Junior Web Developer who will be the newest addition to our team of Developers.
 



  




* You are a competitive person who wants to achieve results and always strives to do your best
* You are a self-driven person who likes to try out new things and take responsibility for your own projects
* You are a well-structured person and able to plan your work tasks
* You are an analytical thinker
* It’s a plus if you are interested in the iGaming industry and/or sports betting, but this is not a requirement
* You have advanced knowledge of working with HTML, CSS and JavaScript
* You have basic knowledge of Programming (preferably PHP)
* You have basic knowledge of Version handling such as Git
* You have an understanding of CMS systems
* You are based in or willing to move to Stockholm
* You are fluent in both English and Swedish
* It is a plus (but not a minus) if you have experience with Amazon Web Services (Amazon S3, EC2), MySQL, SEO, Technical SEO (Web Core Vitals) or Web design



  





  





**Job description** 




 Your work tasks will include the following:
 


* Updating and maintaining our websites, as well as supporting the people that are working on them
* New development around Leadstar Media’s product (websites)
* Collaborating and communicating with the different teams based on incoming requests



 At Leadstar Media you always have the possibility to grow within the company and take on more responsibilities. Several of our team members have taken career steps within the company. The ambition to learn and the ability to take on responsibility are the essential skills required of prospective employees.
 



  





  





**About Leadstar Media** 




 Leadstar Media is a fast growing Swedish scale-up company that operates several websites within the sports betting industry. Today the company consists of over 70 employees and full-time consultants as well as several part-time freelancers. We are an international company with around 30 different nationalities represented and a presence in over 30 different geographical markets. Leadstar Media’s ambition is to create exceptional products for our visitors and to become the no. 1 sports betting affiliate in the world. We believe that the best way to achieve this is by having a tight-knit team of creators with a high level of autonomy.
 



 At Leadstar Media you will work together with entrepreneurial individuals who are eager to learn everything about their particular field. We want you to have the same winner mindset as the rest of the team!
 



 In addition to work, we organize other activities outside of work-hours such as small events, company trips and kick-offs.
 



 At Leadstar Media you always have the opportunity to grow within the company and take on more responsibility. Several of our talents have grown to become true stars and leaders. We have learned that the most important skills you need for this job are an ambition to learn, and the ability to take on responsibility.
 



**More information** 




 Start: As soon as possible
 



 Period of employment: six months probationary employment with one month of notice.
 



 We are looking forward to receiving your job application!
 



 Follow Leadstar Media on Linkedin
 



 Follow Leadstar Media on Instagram
 



 Follow Leadstar Media on Facebook

title: Full Stack Developer to Moleculent
description:
*Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company at the forefront of life science innovation? Are you passionate about building software that combines intuitive interfaces with powerful control and analysis capabilities? Join Moleculent as a Full Stack Developer and help develop products that uncover the molecular foundations of human biology.*
*Moleculent is on a mission to build products that yield new insights into the molecular foundation of human biology. This is a chance for you to join a focused and dedicated team with extensive experience building successful life-science companies and products. This is a permanent position based in Solna, Stockholm.*
*We welcome your application today!*
*Please note that consultant applications are not being considered at this time.*
**Job Description**
 As a Full Stack Developer at Moleculent, you will design and develop user-friendly applications that tightly integrate with instrument control systems and data analysis pipelines. You will be part of a friendly, experienced software team working closely with hardware, system, and data analysis engineers. Your role will include both front-end and back-end development, from concept to deployment.
   

  

 You will be responsible for building intuitive graphical user interfaces using Flutter and Dart, while ensuring robust backend functionality using Python. You will also be involved in designing APIs, integrating cloud services, and participating in agile team activities such as code reviews, sprint planning, and retrospectives.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Develop front-end applications using Flutter (Dart) and HTML-based frameworks
* Design and implement back-end services and APIs using Python
* Ensure seamless integration between UI, control systems, and analysis software
* Write clean, maintainable, and version-controlled code using Git and Bitbucket
* Take part in testing, troubleshooting, and improving software quality
* Participate in planning, drafting requirements, and contributing to agile workflows
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams across R&D, product management, and marketing


**Qualifications**
 To fit the role, you have a BSc or MSc, most likely in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. Fluent written and spoken English is required.
   

  

 You have 5+ years of experience in full-stack software development, with a strong focus on developing user interfaces and backend services. You are proficient in Flutter (Dart) and Python and have experience designing APIs and integrating cloud-based services. Experience from life science instruments or embedded systems is a big plus.
   

  

**Technical skills:**
* Expert in Flutter (Dart) application development
* Proficient in Python programming
* Strong understanding of RESTful APIs and microservices architecture
* Comfortable working in Linux environments
* Experience with Git, CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Jenkins), and Docker
* Experience in agile methodologies


**Nice to have:**
* Experience in embedded systems
* Cybersecurity awareness in software development
* Knowledge of the “async/await” paradigm and scalable Python architecture


 The right person for this role has strong communication and teamwork skills and thrives in a fast-paced environment where managing multiple tasks and priorities is part of the daily routine. You are curious and adaptable, eager to learn and apply new technologies and frameworks as needed. With a flexible mindset, you are comfortable bridging the gap between front-end design, back-end programming, and system architecture. Above all, you are open-minded and approach data-driven discussions on technical designs objectively, engaging without bias or prejudice.
   

  

**MOLECULENT**
 We believe that our understanding of the molecular basis of human biology, in health and disease, will increase radically in the coming ten years. This will lead to a vast improvement in therapies, and diagnostics, and a new, fundamental understanding of our own biology.
   

  

 Moleculent is on a mission to develop technology-enabled products that leverage new insights into the molecular foundation of human biology.
   

  

 https://www.moleculent.com/

title: Junior Software Engineer (framtida CTO), endast equity
description:
Spyrely söker en Junior Software Engineer (framtida CTO)/ Co-Founder – deltid, endast equity
   

  

 Är du en ambitiös utvecklare som vill vara med från början och bygga något på riktigt? Vill du växa in i en CTO-roll och samtidigt vara med och forma ett techbolag i tidigt skede?
   

  

 Spyrely är en early-stage startup som automatiserar konkurrentbevakning för små och medelstora företag. Vi hjälper bolag att följa sina konkurrenters nyheter, kampanjer, produktlanseringar och rekryteringar – enkelt, automatiskt och datadrivet.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en Junior Software Engineer – en smart, driven person som är i slutet av sina studier eller har 1–3 års erfarenhet, och som vill bygga något från grunden tillsammans med oss.
   

  

 Vem du är:
   

 – Sista året civilingenjörstudent, PhD student eller har 1–3 års relevant erfarenhet
   

 – Gärna teknisk utbildning (t.ex. datateknik, IT, teknisk fysik eller motsvarande)
   

 – Du har byggt egna projekt eller varit del i mindre utvecklingsteam
   

 – Du gillar produktutveckling, problemlösning och att ta ansvar
   

 – Du vill arbeta nära affären och påverka både teknik och strategi
   

 – Du har ambitionen att växa in i en CTO-roll över tid
   

  

 Vad du kommer göra:
   

 – Vidareutveckla vår första version av plattformen
   

 – Utforska och välja rätt teknisk infrastruktur för framtiden
   

 – Samarbeta med grundarna för att prioritera rätt features och bygga MVP:er
   

 – Lägga grunden för ett techteam och leda utvecklingen på sikt
   

  

 Vad vi erbjuder:
   

 – En medgrundarroll med equity – du blir delägare
   

 – En plats vid beslutsbordet – du påverkar hela bolagets utveckling
   

 – En tydlig väg till CTO-roll och möjlighet att bygga ett team runt dig
   

 – Flexibla arbetstider, deltid och remote-vänligt
   

 – Möjlighet att bygga något meningsfullt i en tydlig marknad med konkret behov
   

  

 Varför Spyrely?
   

 Konkurrentbevakning är idag manuellt, dyrt och ineffektivt. Spyrely gör det automatiserat, strukturerat och tillgängligt – något många bolag behöver, men få löser bra idag. Vi bygger för verkliga användare och riktiga behov.

title: .NET Developer CRM
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Utvecklare på Sopra Steria – skapa framtidens lösningar med oss!**
 Hos oss på Sopra Steria arbetar du med alla delar av utvecklingsprocessen, från koncept till implementation och förvaltning. Du får bryta ner komplexa problem och skapa anpassade lösningar till kunder med den allra senaste tekniken, med grund i Microsofts hela portfölj av tjänster. Som utvecklare i .NET rör vi oss över hela stacken, vilket gör att arbetsuppgifterna under en vecka kan variera. Att arbeta med Microsofts paraply av molntjänster, som dessutom ständigt utökas, gör att du kan bli specialist inom ditt kompetensområde, men ändå alltid ha mer att lära.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna som utvecklare hos oss kan t.ex. innebära att:
   

  

* Anpassa funktionaliteten i Dynamics CRM genom utveckling av tillägg i C# och klientanpassningar i JavaScript/TypeScript
* Skapa .NET Core-applikationer för att integrera till och från Dynamics CRM
* Skapa low code-lösningar baserat på Power Apps och Power Automate
* Skapa förutsägbara och stabila releaser med verktyg som Azure DevOps, TeamCity, Octopus Deploy m.fl.


**Om dig**
 Vi söker både dig som har tidigare erfarenhet av .NET-utveckling inom Dynamics CE och dig som är erfaren .NET-utvecklare och nu vill bygga vidare på dina kunskaper!
   

  

*Antingen har du:*
* 3 års erfarenhet som utvecklare backend, C# .NET
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Power Apps, Power Automate, Dataverse, Azure eller andra kringliggande tjänster inom området
* God kommunikativ förmåga i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


*Eller:*
* 5+ års erfarenhet som utvecklare backend, C# .NET
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult
* God kommunikativ förmåga i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


**Varför välja Sopra Steria**
* Fokus på kompetensutveckling och din personliga utveckling - vi kallar det för Power of sharing
* Stark företagskultur - utsedda till Sveriges bästa arbetsplats av Great Place to Work
* Många teamleveranser!


**Ansök nu – vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!**
 Vi behandlar ansökningar och kallar till intervju löpande. På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen består av tre intervjuer, ett logiskt test, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll. Denna kombination av urvalsmetoder ger oss en bredare och mer rättvis bild av dig som kandidat, samtidigt som det säkerställer att både dina tekniska och personliga styrkor kommer till sin rätt. För dig som kandidat innebär det en möjlighet att visa din kompetens och potential från flera perspektiv.
   

  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller oss som bolag är du välkommen att kontakta Victoria på v.stjernstroem@soprasteria.com
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Help us redefine what it means to be a financial partner for everyday heroes**
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make personal finance better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 400+ amazing people who work here.**
**With the vision to become a trusted personal finance partner, our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
**Right now** 
**we are looking for frontend engineers** 
 who want to be part of this journey, who care about impact, not just output. With a product mindset, you will help shape the next phase of our growth.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Build intuitive, performant, and customer-first interfaces with React (TS/JS).
* Collaborate closely with design, backend, and business colleagues to deliver seamless experiences.
* Contribute to product discovery and influence technical choices.
* Write clean, reliable code and take ownership from idea to production.
* Help evolve our frontend practices and processes as we grow.


**What We Are Looking For**
* 5+ years of frontend or fullstack experience with frequent product shipping
* Strong skills in React and modern TypeScript/JavaScript
* Experience with or curiosity for our stack: Node.js, React, TypeScript/JavaScript, Next.js, and AWS (including CDK and CloudFormation)
* Solid experience building frontend systems that balance usability with performance, maintainability, and scalability.
* Bonus: React Native, app-first mindset, AI-driven workflows.
* Above all: a product mindset, you want to understand why we build things and you see impact as important as delivery.


**Why this role?**
* Shape the experience: Play a key role in how customers interact with our products and bring design ideas to life.
* Build for impact: Create intuitive and accessible interfaces that thousands of people rely on every day.
* Grow and explore: Join at a stage where team missions and ventures expand, giving you the chance to explore different problem spaces over time.
* Work with purpose: What you design and build directly empowers everyday people to take control of their finances and improve their lives.


**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees.
* A workplace where people genuinely enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


**Please note**
 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you not to include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.
   

  

 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 400 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in all markets.

title: Python Developer
description:
**About Us** 




 AVTECH is a Swedish SaaS company in the aviation industry, headquartered on the 23rd floor of Kista Science Tower in Stockholm. We develop advanced digital services that help airlines worldwide optimize their operations – from fuel savings and flight trajectory optimization to improved punctuality and reduced environmental impact.
 



 We are in a strong growth phase and are expanding our product development team with a
 **Python Developer** 
 . This is a great opportunity to join a collaborative, international team where your work will be directly used by airlines around the world.
 



  
 



**The Role** 




 We are looking for an
 **intermediate-level Python Developer** 
 with at least 3–5 years of professional experience and a genuine drive to build robust, scalable systems. You may have had two or more previous developer roles where Python was your main language, and now you are looking for a place where you can contribute to building long-lasting software – not just patchwork or quick fixes.
 



 You’ll be working across our product portfolio, mainly using Python and Django, but also touching on databases, APIs, cloud services, and DevOps pipelines. You’ll collaborate closely with other developers, architects, and the CTO to deliver features and improvements that make a real difference in aviation operations.
 



  
 



**What You’ll Do** 



* Develop, maintain, and improve AVTECH’s Python-based services (mainly Django).
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code with a focus on long-term quality.
* Collaborate with other developers, architects, and stakeholders to design and deliver features.
* Work with PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and APIs to build reliable and performant applications.
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and cloud deployment in AWS.
* Be part of a fast-moving team where your work is quickly deployed into production and used worldwide.



  
 



  
 



**What We’re Looking For** 



* 3–5 years of professional experience as a software developer, primarily in
 **Python** 
 .
* Experience with
 **Django** 
 or similar Python frameworks.
* Solid understanding of databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or similar).
* Familiarity with Git and modern development workflows.
* Knowledge of cloud environments and CI/CD practices is a plus (AWS, Docker, Kubernetes).
* A self-driven and motivated person who wants to build proper systems, not just quick fixes.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills.
* Fluency in English (spoken and written) is required. Swedish is a plus.



  





**What We Offer** 



* A central role in building software that directly impacts the global aviation industry.
* The opportunity to work on modern technology in a fast-growing company.
* A hybrid workplace with flexible hours, based in Kista Science Tower, Stockholm.
* Competitive salary, bonus scheme, and attractive benefits.
* A supportive and international team where your code goes straight into production.



  
 



**Interested?** 



* Apply today! Applications are reviewed continuously.

title: Software Engineer (IaaS)
description:
Everyone's story matters. Come shape your story with us at Riverty.
 



  





**But where does that take you?** 




  





 To one of our 30 hybrid workspaces – designed for exchanging ideas, learning from others, and shaping the way we work. An international community of over 4,000 people, representing almost 80 nationalities across 11 countries. United by one mission: Combining empathy, advanced technology and data-driven insights to keep people and businesses in flow. With payments made for them. So that they don't have to worry about it.
 



**And there's more:** 
 We are part of the family-owned Bertelsmann group. Established. Corporate. In a fast-paced industry. We enable flexible payments in various industries, simplifying the financial management of known brands and helping people repay debt to build financial confidence. In short: shaping FinTech.
 



  





**We are looking for** 




**Software Engineer** 




**to join our team at our location in Oslo or Stockholm** 




  





**(Y)our Mission:** 




 Our solutions contribute to flexible and customer-friendly payment alternatives. We allow consumers to choose when and how they want to pay, guaranteeing merchants a steady and predictable cash flow. Our products make us proud, but not content, and we have high ambitions for our existing and upcoming products. We’re now modernizing and strengthening one of our key products with renewed focus in the Nordics — backed by the strength of a global group, but with the energy and ownership of a startup. You’ll join a newly formed product & tech team, helping shape how we work and how we grow as we double down on building sustainable, human-centric FinTech solutions.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities:** 



* In this role, you will work as a full-stack engineer, primarily focusing on backend tasks and having smaller front-end responsibilities. You will join one of our products, and your daily tasks will be:
* Design, develop, test, and ship robust, maintainable, and readable software, applications, APIs, and other workflows.
* Attend regular scrum ceremonies as a member of an agile cross-functional team.
* Analyze, discuss and implement business requirements while maintaining good documentation of the systems and components you create.
* Adopt, implement, and provide feedback on organizational and industry standards and practices that will positively impact on our engineering culture.



  





**What will help you to succeed in the role:** 



* A university degree in the IT field
* Hands-on experience with C# and the .NET framework.
* Experience in frontend development with any modern JavaScript framework (e.g., Angular).
* Some experience in developing, shipping, and maintaining cloud-based applications.
* A good understanding of RESTful APIs.
* Familiarity with microservices and distributed architecture is a plus.
* Experience with relational databases, preferably SQL Server.
* Knowledge of cloud development and experience with Azure is a bonus.
* Written and spoken English proficiency to communicate and collaborate with our international team.



  





**About the technologies we use:** 




 Our teams have autonomy regarding tech choices. The example below will give you some insights, and we look forward to discussing this further.
 



 All solutions developed cloud-native targeting Azure - Infrastructure defined using Terraform - Services deployed to Kubernetes clusters by default - A growing microservice ecosystem with event-based integration - Using latest .NET Core - RESTful API design - Single-page frontend apps served by CDN - Frontend tech using TypeScript, often Angular or standard Web Components (Stencil) - Automated tests in each layer - Design collaboration using Figma.
 



  





 Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
 



 We want to be a fair and inclusive employer. We value the diverse perspectives that a diverse workforce brings to the table. Therefore, we are actively looking for people who enrich our company through their identity, background and personal experiences, with or without a disability.
 



  





**Benefits:** 



* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About This Opportunity**
 Do you have a passion for finance, forecasting, and driving smart investment decisions? We’re looking for an experienced, creative, and dynamic Radio Investment Controller to join our outstanding team within the TE1 domain in the IV&C department at PDU Radio.
   

  

 In this pivotal role, you will own the forecasting process for hardware and software investments, manage Capex/Opex budgets, and provide clear, data-driven insights to support decision-making. You will collaborate with stakeholders and cross-functional teams, ensuring resources are directed where they bring the most value. You won’t shy away from challenging assumptions – your critical thinking and ability to say 'no' when necessary will help guide sound financial outcomes.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Lead financial forecasting and budgeting for Radio testing and development projects.
* Partner with stakeholders to review, challenge, and refine investment proposals.
* Evaluate and qualify hardware prototypes, driving innovation and quality.
* Prepare and deliver concept reviews for strategic decisions.
* Research new tools and methods to meet future requirements.
* Maintain high standards of documentation and compliance.
* Coach R&D colleagues and act as a competence builder through workshops and presentations.
* Support cross-organizational projects and drive collaborative success.


**The Skills You Bring**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (or equivalent experience) in finance, engineering, or related field.
* Strong financial and forecasting skills, with advanced Microsoft Excel capability.
* General understanding of RF and Filter Technology, plus design experience in RF.
* Knowledge of Radio Products and technologies including WCDMA, GSM, 4G, and 5G.
* Exceptional problem-solving skills and the confidence to challenge stakeholders.
* Clear and compelling communication abilities in English.
* A calm, diplomatic, and professional demeanor.
* Prior experience within similar industry is a strong advantage.


 Why Join Us? We work in lean, agile, multi-functional teams where diversity, collaboration, and knowledge-sharing inspire true innovation. Here, your work directly shapes the future of global radio technology.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 773744

title: Senior Software Engineer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media and Software Development
description:
**Senior .NET Developers - Stockholm - Hybrid** 




  





**Please Note:** 
 This is a permanent role.
 **This role is for Swedish residents only** 
 . This role does not offer Sponsorship.
 **You must have the right to work in Sweden with no restrictions.** 
 Some of our roles
 *may* 
 be subject to successful background/security checks.
 



  





 📍
 **Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



 🗣️
 **Language Requirement:** 
 Fluent in Swedish
 



 💼
 **Role:** 
 .NET Fullstack Developer
 



 📅
 **Start Date:** 
 Flexible
 



 🏢
 **Workplace:** 
 Hybrid (client site + remote)
 



  





**About the Company** 




 Our client is a Stockholm-based consultancy with a unique position in the Swedish tech ecosystem, they’re involved with pretty much every tech company in Sweden. From well-funded startups to established tech giants, they have one of the broadest and most exciting client networks in the country.
 



  





 They’re known for pairing technical excellence with a collaborative, low-ego approach. Developers there work on meaningful, high-impact projects in fast-paced environments, all while staying connected to Sweden’s top-tier tech scene.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 Our client is currently expanding their team of experienced .NET Fullstack Developers to meet growing demand across several high-profile engagements. If you're looking for variety, autonomy, and the chance to work in dynamic environments where your skills make a real impact, this role is for you.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Build robust, scalable web applications using .NET/C#, ASP.NET Core, and modern JavaScript frameworks
* Collaborate with designers, stakeholders, and product teams
* Help shape technical direction and architecture
* Adapt to different client needs and tech stacks
* Deliver high-quality code in agile environments



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




 ✅ 5+ years of experience as a .NET Fullstack Developer
 



 ✅ Solid background in C#, ASP.NET Core, and REST API development
 



 ✅ Frontend skills is a plus
 



 ✅ Experience with cloud platforms like Azure or AWS
 



 ✅ Comfort working in CI/CD and DevOps-oriented teams
 



 ✅ Fluent Swedish (spoken and written)
 



 ✅ A collaborative, curious, and pragmatic mindset
 



  





**Why This Opportunity Stands Out** 




 ✨ Work with Sweden’s most exciting tech companies
 



 ✨ Exposure to a wide range of industries and projects
 



 ✨ Strong engineering culture with a focus on growth
 



 ✨ Hybrid flexibility – office, remote, and client-site work
 



 ✨ Competitive salary, pension, and wellness benefits

title: Sr. Software Engineer - E-Commerce
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 




  





**At Yubico, we offer:**




  





**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 

  





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  





**The Role:
 
  






 As a Sr. Software Engineer you will be the lead engineer for Yubico’s eCommerce platform backend. You will build and maintain e-commerce features, as well as integrations with supply chain, finance, customer support, and payment systems.
 




  






 We are looking for you who have a burning passion for backend development. You love seeing how a system comes to life and understand the important synergy between databases, application code and APIs. You are curious and always want to expand your knowledge in the areas you are passionate about, as well as in security protocols and technologies. You are also not afraid of expressing your concerns or new ideas you want others to hear about. You like to share your work and findings with colleagues and enjoy discussing subjects in the areas you are passionate about.
 





  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Suggest, design and implement new system features.
* Maintain the technical aspects of our ecommerce backend
* Design and implement integrations with the rest of Yubico’s back end systems
* Provide support on the platform for internal users
* Participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation (average <1 incident/month in the last 12 months)
* Mentor junior developer colleagues



  




**Skills & Experience:** 
* 7+ years of experience in PHP, including deep knowledge of object oriented principles, dependency injection and design patterns
* Experience leading projects including design and development of back-end features
* 5+ years of design and implementation experience with relational SQL databases
* Experience creating and consuming REST APIs
* Hands-on experience in one or more of the following technologies: Kubernetes, Docker, GCP
* Self-motivated and interested in the e-commerce area



  




**Bonus:** 
* Experience with Magento
* 3+ years of experience with modern frameworks, e.g. Laravel or Symfony
* Experience with cross-system integrations, such as Netsuite.
* Experience with ID brokering and OpenID standard (e.g. Keycloak)
* Experience with e-commerce and supply chain operations
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Github Actions)
* Linux experience






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 



  





 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 



  





 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 



  





 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.****

title: Senior Fullstack Developer – Build the Future of Mobility with Aimo IT
description:
**By continuing to think innovatively and always putting people’s needs first, we believe we can make a real difference. As the leading mobility partner in the Nordic region, we are constantly developing new solutions that make everyday life simpler and more sustainable. We are Aimo.**
**About The Job**
 As a Senior Fullstack Developer at Aimo IT, you’ll work hands-on across the stack while guiding your team to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions. You’ll be trusted to take ownership of both technical execution and leadership, driving structure and progress in a hybrid team setup.
   

  

* Build and maintain end-to-end solutions – from customer-facing features to backend services.
* Participate daily standups, support prioritization, and secure delivery pace.
* Partner with solution architects, QA, and other developers to ensure best practices across teams.
* Balance hands-on coding with leadership responsibilities, influencing architecture and delivery methods.
* Play a central role in reducing consultant dependency and building stronger internal capabilities.


**About You**
 You are an experienced developer – ready to step into the role. What drives you is not just writing code, but problemsolving, creating clarity, enabling others, and shaping long-term solutions that matter.
   

  

* Strong fullstack experience (React, Node.js, TypeScript/JavaScript, APIs, databases).
* Ability to work with cross-functional teams, be a driver in technical discussions, and influence architecture decisions.
* Solid understanding of CI/CD pipelines and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
* Pragmatic mindset: balancing speed, scalability, and quality.
* Strong collaborator: sharing knowledge and mentoring others.
* Bonus: Atlassian tools, containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), or IT governance frameworks.


**About Us**
 With more than 50 years of experience in parking services and pioneering knowledge in car sharing, we are shaping the future of mobility. We are building comprehensive charging infrastructure for electric cars, creating efficient mobility hubs, launching new digital services, and continuously expanding our fleet of electric vehicles.

title: DevOps Engineer / Developer
description:
**DevOps Engineer / Developer – AVTECH Sweden** 




**About Us** 




 AVTECH is a Swedish SaaS company in the aviation industry, headquartered on the 23rd floor of Kista Science Tower in Stockholm. We develop advanced digital services that help airlines worldwide optimize their operations – from fuel savings and flight trajectory optimization to improved punctuality and reduced environmental impact.
 



 We are in a strong growth phase and now expanding our product development team with a DevOps Engineer / Developer. This is a key role where you’ll help transform how we build, test, release, and operate our products, making sure we can scale our delivery while maintaining high reliability and speed.
 



  
 



**The Role** 





 We are looking for a skilled developer with a strong DevOps mindset. In this role, you will primarily focus on modernizing our development and operations practices, but you will also contribute to product development as part of our engineering team.
 



 Your mission will be to overhaul our CI/CD pipelines, introduce containerization and Kubernetes, and support our migration to AWS. At the same time, you’ll contribute directly to our codebase – mainly in Python, which is central to both our products and DevOps tooling.
 



 Simply put: we need someone who loves to automate, but who is also a developer at heart. You’ll work closely with the CTO and our System Architect, while still driving your work independently. You’ll also play an important role in helping other developers adopt new ways of working.
 



  
 



**What You’ll Do** 



* Redesign and modernize AVTECH’s CI/CD pipelines for speed, reliability, and scalability.
* Lead the introduction of containerization and Kubernetes in our environments.
* Support and drive the migration of our infrastructure to AWS.
* Automate deployment, testing, monitoring, and operational workflows.
* Contribute to product development, primarily in Python (Django, data pipelines, services).
* Promote DevOps best practices and guide developers in adopting modern tooling and workflows.
* Collaborate closely with the CTO and the System Architect to align infrastructure with product and business goals.



  
 



**What We’re Looking For** 



* Solid background in software development (preferably Python).
* Strong DevOps skills and hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, or similar).
* Experience with containerization and Kubernetes.
* Knowledge of AWS (networking, security, infrastructure as code).
* Strong interest in automation and cloud-native operations.
* Ability to drive your own work independently, take initiative, and lead change.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to coach other developers.
* Fluency in English (spoken and written) is required. Swedish is a plus.



  





**What We Offer** 



* A central role in transforming how AVTECH builds and operates software.
* The opportunity to work with modern technologies in the aviation industry.
* A hybrid workplace with flexible hours, based in Kista Science Tower, Stockholm.
* Competitive salary, bonus scheme, and attractive benefits.
* A collaborative international team where your work makes a direct impact.



  
 



**Interested?** 




 Apply today! Applications are reviewed continuously.

title: Utvecklare
description:
På Getswish är vi mitt i en spännande tillväxtresa där vi tar hem utveckling och drift och nu söker ännu fler grymma utvecklare till våra team i Stockholm och Östersund!
 



  





 Här jobbar vi tight tillsammans i bolaget för att skapa stabila och pålitliga tjänster som varje dag förenklar vardagen för miljoner användare.
 



  





 Vi är stolta över vår produkt och över att Swish är förstahandsvalet för vardagsbetalningar i Sverige. Nu vill vi ha med dig på vår resa framåt!
 



  





**Vad gör en Swishutvecklare?** 




 Hos oss får du arbeta i team som utvecklar, förvaltar och driver utvecklingen av Swish, från idé till nya funktioner i 8,6 miljoner svenskars mobiler. Vi letar efter lagspelare som gillar att ta initiativ och vill jobba med alla typer av aktiviteter som finns inom ramen för systemutveckling och operations.
 



  





 Swish ställer höga krav på tillgänglighet och kvalité på de nya funktioner vi bygger och på att de befintliga funktioner vi har alltid beter sig som förväntat. Det betyder att du varje dag kommer möta spännande tekniska utmaningar, inom nyutveckling och förvaltning och hela tiden har koll på hur Swish presterar.
 



  





 Vår techorganisation växer och utvecklas ständigt. Vi ser fram emot att du bidrar, både med tekniska idéer och med hur vi kan jobba ännu bättre tillsammans.
 



 Rollen innebär även beredskapsarbete.
 



  





**Exempel på tekniker och verktyg du kommer att jobba med:** 



* Java
* Spring Boot
* Docker & Kubernetes
* Git/Gitlab
* Datadog
* CI/CD
* Typescript, React/Vue, NPM



  





 … och fler, i takt med att vi moderniserar vår teknikstack.
 



  





**Vi tror att du…** 



* Är en skicklig kodare som brinner för teknik och att bygga lösningar med högsta kvalitet
* Är proaktiv och gillar att komma med idéer
* Gillar ”riktig” DevOps och att teamet tar helhetsansvar för det ni bygger
* Har en vass analytisk förmåga
* Får energi av att samarbeta och dela kunskap med andra
* Gillar en organisation med korta beslutsvägar
* Talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat



  





**Det här får du hos oss** 



* En snabbfotad organisation med stor grad av frihet under ansvar
* Fantastiska kollegor(!!)
* Möjlighet att bidra till och förändra framtiden för betalningar i Sverige
* En kultur där gemenskap, engagemang och utveckling står i fokus
* Sociala aktiviteter: allt från AW:s och föreläsningar till träning och fredagsfrukostar
* Möjlighet till hybridarbete, kontor mitt i smeten i Stockholm och Östersund



  





**Bra att veta** 




 För oss är personlig lämplighet viktigare än att CVt matchar i varenda detalj, rätt attityd och vilja att lära är avgörande.
 



  





 Vi söker enbart kandidater för anställning – konsultförfrågningar undanbedes.
 



  





 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens Swish? 💙
 



  





**Rekryteringen sker löpande, skicka in din ansökan redan idag!** 




  





*I vår beredskapsplanering ingår att alla tillsvidareanställda är krigsplacerade i bolaget. I praktiken innebär det att du vid höjd beredskap i samhället arbetar vidare i din ordinarie roll, med särskild prioritet att stötta verksamhetens samhällsviktiga funktion.* 




  





**Om Swish** 




 Swish lanserades 2012 och har sedan dess blivit hela Sveriges betalapp och en av de största mobila betalningslösningarna i Europa. Bolaget Getswish AB ansvarar för Swish infrastruktur, tjänster samt varumärket Swish, som på kort tid blivit Sveriges starkaste och mest omtyckta.
 



  





 Getswish jobbar dagligen med att förenkla vardagen för 8,6 miljoner privatpersoner och 300 000 företag. Getswish har cirka 100 medarbetare och kontor i centrala Stockholm och Östersund.
 



 Getswish utvecklar kontinuerligt nya produkter, förbättrar existerande tjänster och utvärderar innovativa idéer. Vi är ett litet passionerat bolag med höga ambitioner att tillhandahålla tjänster och funktioner i framkant.

title: Identity Security Developer Sailpoint
description:
Are you ready for a change? To make the world a safer place?
   

  

 ID North offers products and services in the entire field of identity security (IAM, IGA, PAM), which is a central part of IT security. We are the leading company in Sweden and intend to further distance ourselves from the competition in the entire Nordics. We are on an exciting growth journey, which is why we are now looking for more solution developers who want to join our team and develop tomorrow’s identity security solutions for our customers!
   

  

**Your mission** 
 📌
   

  

 As a Developer, you will implement advanced solutions based on the customer’s needs and requirements, such as secure login, integration for automatic account creation, and management of administrator rights. The assignments are technically exciting and challenging, and those passionate about developing technical breadth are in the right place to become an expert. Working together in a project team with a project manager, solution architect, and solution developer, you will be involved in delivering top-notch identity security solutions within Project Delivery and/or our Service Delivery Organization!
   

  

**In your role, you will need to:** 
 💻
   

  

 Have an interest in configuring technically broad solutions in complex environments using market-leading products tailored to the customer’s needs.
   

  

 Be able to integrate systems for secure login and information flows for identities, accounts, and permissions.
   

  

 Work with customers and help them understand the solution being built.
   

  

 It is a merit to have worked with IAM, IGA, and/or PAM solutions before with the technology of one of our solution partners.
   

  

 Knowledge of Active Directory/LDAP, Web Services, and standards such as SAML, OpenID Connect, OAuth2, SCIM is advantageous.
   

  

 It is also a merit to have knowledge and experience with Linux and Windows environments, MySQL and MSSQL databases, Java and Tomcat, Apache httpd, certificate management/SSL/TLS/PKI.
   

  

 Version control and release management with tools like Subversion or Git, as well as Ant or Maven, are advantageous.
   

  

 Experience and knowledge with identity security products from SailPoint, Savyint Opentext, Okta, Nexus, CyberArk, Microsoft is a major plus.
   

  

 There may be business trips in the role. We have offices in Stockholm, Borås, Gothenburg, Denmark and Helsinki, so your location can be flexible based on your needs and life situation.
   

  

**Your competence** 
 📓
   

  

 We are looking for someone with an IT technical developer background. Experience and knowledge in identity security are highly valued but not a requirement. We prefer if you have worked in teams/projects with customers as consultants and are unafraid to take on new technical challenges. Understanding of information flows, system integration, and basic programming skills are advantageous. You can communicate fluently in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written. A major merit if you have other language skills.
   

  

**Your qualities** 
**⭐️**
 You enjoy working in teams with colleagues and customers, and you like to develop advanced technical solutions that require a broad technical understanding. We prefer that you are solution-oriented and interested in learning how to implement solutions with new products. Are eager to learn and develop your skills and competence. We value your personal qualities highly and are looking for someone who is attentive, has good social skills, and is easy to collaborate with others, both colleagues and customers.
   

  

**We offer** 
 🚀
   

  

 A strong and pleasant company at the forefront of our field, where our expertise and experience give us a competitive position. We offer development opportunities, and you will be surrounded by specialists. All day every day! At ID North, you have good employment benefits, and you will become a key person for us in our delivery. We enjoy each other’s company and take the opportunity to go on trips, adventures, and have fun together on our journey to the top.
   

  

 Does this sound like a position for you? We have an immediate need, so you should not hesitate to apply or send your application. Are you IN?
   

  

 Welcome- Chief Human Resources Officer Linda Öhlin

title: Master Thesis: AI-Powered Impact Analysis for Accelerating CI/CD in Baseband Software
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Are you ready to explore how AI can transform configuration change impact assessments in CI/CD environments? This master’s thesis focuses on designing and prototyping an AI based tool to automatically determine which test cases and installed basebands are affected by documented configuration changes in baseband software. Today, these assessments can introduce significant lead times before changes are delivered, but by automating the process we can accelerate feature delivery and free up developer time for innovation.
   

  

 In this project, you will investigate how generative AI, knowledge graphs, and contextual data retrieval can process configuration change documentation, such as added, deprecated, or removed attributes and attribute setting rules, and output a targeted set of impacted test cases and basebands. The solution should be scalable to our entire code base of test cases and configuration files, with an initial focus on selected areas of CI/CD.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Analyse current manual assessment workflows and identify automation opportunities
* Design an AI powered prototype that transforms configuration change documentation into actionable impact analysis
* Integrate modern AI tools such as LangChain, LangGraph, and VectorDB for semantic search and contextual retrieval
* Apply prompt engineering techniques to refine AI accuracy for technical impact prediction
* Test scalability and performance across different CI/CD areas, moving toward whole system coverage


**The skills you bring:**
* Strong programming skills in Java and Python
* Familiarity with tools and frameworks such as LangChain, LangGraph, VectorDB, and Knowledge Graphs
* Understanding of container and orchestration technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
* Experience with generative AI concepts and prompt engineering
* Ability to work collaboratively in diverse teams, bring bold ideas, take initiative, and deliver results


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 773579

title: Lead AAC Content Developer
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

**About the Role:**
*We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.*
*We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.*
 As a
 **Lead AAC Content Developer** 
 , you'll play a crucial role in developing and maintaining innovative communication content for our AAC software applications, such as TD Snap. In this role, you’ll lead and manage the AAC Content Development team, shaping the strategy and approach for vocabulary and communication content development in our products. This is a great opportunity to play a vital role in empowering individuals with communication-related disabilities, helping them express themselves and connect with the world.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Lead our AAC Content Development team.
* Define strategies and methodologies for developing text- and symbol-based content for AAC software applications.
* Establish and manage the AAC content roadmap, setting priorities and timelines.
* Design products tailored to various communication-related disabilities, applying best practices in AAC design.
* Develop content guidelines to optimize for alternate access methods (eye-gaze, switch-access, touch, etc.) and support language growth.
* Oversee content localization efforts to ensure consistency and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
* Stay current on AAC trends and identify new opportunities.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in AAC or Assistive Technology within clinical or educational settings.
* Prior leadership experience.
* A degree in Speech-Language Pathology, Linguistics, Assistive Technology, or a related field.
* Understanding of software development life cycle and user centric design
* Expertise in language and literacy development, AAC best practices, and content design.
* Strong editorial skills and an eye for detail.


 We’d be even more excited if you also have:
   

  

* Knowledge of programming page sets in one or more AAC software applications.
* Proficiency in Python.
* Deep familiarity with assistive technologies, including eye-gaze and switch-access.


 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Sr. Startups Solutions Architect, AWS Startups
description:
**Description**
 Trusted by more startups around the world, AWS makes the power of cloud computing accessible for all by giving founders everywhere access to the same technology that powers the world’s largest companies. With experience gained from supporting hundreds of thousands of startups that have come before, we help founders prove that their world-changing ideas are possible, at any stage of growth or level of funding. This is why more startups, and over 80% of unicorns, build on AWS.
   

  

 Startup Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with startups of different stages. Supporting the overall technical relationship between customers and AWS, they work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. Solutions Architects also have broader impact at scale, taking a supporting role in creating and presenting technical content and best practices.
   

  

 In this role you will get to practice your creativity, linking technology to tangible solutions and educating AWS customers about the art of the possible. You will have the opportunity to produce cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. You will have the support to grow your expertise in industry and technology areas of depth. Every day you will be learning something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments.
   

  

 You will be part of a team that is responsible for driving adoption of AWS technologies while bringing differentiated value to customers. This is a team dedicated to Startups, an important and growing subset of customers for AWS. Startups follow unique technology adoption patterns and growth trajectories that distinguish them from traditional businesses, so you will be employing engagement strategies and programs tailored to their business needs and technical preferences.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and consistent support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* As a Solutions Architect, you will work directly with customers to accelerate their projects and recommend best-practice architectures in line with their long-term business outcomes.
* You operate as a trusted advisor for startups. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide. You work backwards from their priorities and find inventive ways to add value with solutions utilizing AWS and its Partners’ technology.
* You capture and share the voice of the customer to influence the roadmap of new features and services for AWS. You use your customer understanding to participate the creation or updates of technical content and reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts).
* Evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).


 To be successful in this role you need to be passionate about startups and cloud architectures. You are a builder with genuine curiosity about how technology can support your customers’ business models and objectives. You are a lifetime learner that develops areas of depth in technical domains relevant to your interests and your customer's outcomes. You are prepared to work in a fast-paced environment, where you will be positively challenged and consistently embrace the Amazon Culture.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 The Solutions Architect team at AWS is responsible for helping customers successfully implement cloud technologies. In a typical week you will meet multiple customers and you will collaborate with them on designing and operating well-architected solutions. You will earn their trust and show them the art of the possible, educating them around the capabilities of AWS. Partnering with internal teams and experts, leveraging a deep knowledge of our tools and products, you’ll craft highly-scalable, flexible, and resilient cloud architectures that address our customers’ business problems. As part of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to continuously learn and innovate daily.
   

  

**About The Team**
 About AWS
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics).
* Experience in design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures
* Experience in IT development or implementation/consulting in the software or Internet industries


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
* Experience in infrastructure architecture, database architecture and networking
* Experience working with end user or developer communities


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information.
